vmassol - (14:33): that' swhat I don't understand

vmassol - (14:34): if you're testing it's not a good idea to use the lists

vmassol - (14:35): (a normal email that is)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:35): Guess I'm a show off.  
vmassol - (14:35): :)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:35): My main worry was that the list was going to eat the HTML, that's hard to test without sending to the list.

vmassol - (14:38): the pb is that you're sending soemthing without context  
vmassol - (14:39): btw it didn't work for me  
vmassol - (14:39): (I don't know what it was supposed to do)  
vmassol - (14:39): (but since nothing happens I guess it doesn't work)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:39): What did you try to do?  
vmassol - (14:39): I clicked on accept  
vmassol - (14:39): then it asked me to log in  
vmassol - (14:39): once I was logged in it asked me to register  
vmassol - (14:39): I closed my broweser tab  
vmassol - (14:39): then I clicked again on accept  
vmassol - (14:40): and it said the invitation is only valid once

vmassol - (14:40): I already have access there  
vmassol - (14:40): and why would I need to register again there  
vmassol - (14:40): since I already have an account  
vmassol - (14:40): and just logged in  
vmassol - (14:41): one comment: the UI for the mail has to be worked on  
vmassol - (14:41): the buttons are not visible

vmassol - (14:42): but caty could help for this  
vmassol - (14:42): no hurry

vmassol - (14:43): and one of them happen to be buttons  
vmassol - (14:44): but that's a detail  
vmassol - (14:44): compared to the feature  
vmassol - (14:44): I wasn't able to make it work I think  
vmassol - (14:44): or I don't understand it

vmassol - (14:45): but I don't know, that's the pb of the mail  
vmassol - (14:45): I don't underatdn what it's about

CalebJamesDeLisl - (14:46): (those who didn't know about it.)
